alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 07 at 2:35AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following counties, Morgan, Perry and Washington. * WHEN...Through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A cold front will bring additional rainfall today with thunderstorms also possible. This could produce 1 to 2 inches of rain in some areas, causing flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
